issues.title: Back and Refresh Attack
issues.description:
During external security audit by PwC, it was observed that on pressing the back button after entering user credentials, the previous request containing the credentials entered by the user is resent to the server.

In a scenario when the user has entered correct username but mistyped the password, the user would get an error message. If an attacker accesses the same device, presses the back button and intercepts the request, the attacker would be able to find out the credentials previously entered by the user. An attacker can then try to gain access to the account by trying to brute forcing the password field.

It is recommended that on entering wrong login credentials, the user should be redirected to a dummy intermediate page which redirects the user to the login page again. In that case, on pressing the back button, the intermediate page would be intercepted as the last request.

issues.title: Project List enhancements
issues.description:
- Add Start Date, End Date, Managed by (Name of the organization of the PMO user, comma separated in case of multiple), Budget in (MOU) (This is a value from project Summary) 
- Ability to sort on all columns
- download the data as CSV - in CSV also include following fields additionally
* [x] Planned Budget (This is a value from Budget Tab), 
* [x] Cause Area (comma separated in case of multiple)
* [x] Beneficiary Type
* [x] No Beneficiary Expected (this is a value from project summary)
* [x] Actual Beneficiary (this is a value from Key Project Info) 
* [x] Locations (comma separated in case of multiple) 

Check attached for further details on look and feel.
[Project_List_Enhancements.pptx](/uploads/a727e7784ccceeb032494b27a2141d58/Project_List_Enhancements.pptx)

notes.note:
In download project list report (csv)
* [x] Both Planned Budget & Allocated Budget Values are shown and they are shown properly
* [x] In column headings, Beneficiaries, spelling and heading name needs to be corrected 
* [x] "No of Beneficiares" -> "No of Beneficiaries planned" 
* [x] "Actual Beneficiary" ->  " No of Beneficiaries served" 
* [x] No of Beneficiaries planned column should show the number entered in project summary, but this is shown in  "Actual Beneficiary". This needs to be corrected.
* [x] Verified logic of  "Actual Beneficiary" calculation i.e. values across all the months for parameter identified as a beneficiary is used to calculate " No of Beneficiaries served" [But as mentioned above this is shown in the wrong column] - checked if two parameters indicate Beneficiary values for both are used to calculate  " No of Beneficiaries served". Also, the parameter is case sensitive, i.e. i used employee and Employees as two diff parameter names, with the only employee indicating beneficiary, in this case value of  Employees were excluded as expected/
* [x] Verified that Add New Project or Edit Project (only in case of admin user) has the ability to specify parameter names which indicates beneficiary. Better interface for this is providing check-box on Update Parameters page in front of each parameter. For now this is OK but the label should be changed from "Keywords" to  "Parameters Indicating Beneficiary" also instead of "Enter tags" as help text it should be "Enter Parameter name" 
* [x] Found that all the Key parameters added in the project are by default added to  "Keywords" which need to be changed to "Parameters Indicating Beneficiary", this should be avoided because if admin forgot to remove the non-beneficiary parameter then results will be wrong (and on the higher side)  
* [x] Verified parameter name can have space and it gets added by either tab, enter or ,. Also once specified on project summary page (add/edit project) the parameter is created by default and can be seen on update parameters page. While this is good in case of parameter type is "number" but not when type needs to be either of pie-chart, percent or currency. Because there is no way to edit parameter type. Also at the time of adding a parameter, it gives suggestions which is quite a long list and annoying because it is difficult to comprehend, not sure from where this data is fetched. 
* [ ] How parameter having type other than numbers treated. e.g. i added employees as a parameter (indicating beneficiary) but with type as pie-chart numbers - to capture Male and Female values. These values were not used in "No of Beneficiaries served" calculation.

issues.title: Improper Error Handling ( Debug = TRUE in django settings)
issues.description:
It was observed during PwC external audit that default django error pages were being thrown by the application. Debug = TRUE was found to be set in django settings.

Default django error pages provide a lot of information about the application setup such as the version of python on the remote server, version of Apache on the remote server, folder path where the application root is present etc.

An attacker can use the information from the default error pages to gain an understanding about the backend application settings and use this information in further attacks.

It is recommended that default error pages should be disabled on the web application. Users should be displayed custom error messages when an error occurs which should not include any information about the infrastructure of the application.

issues.title: Malicious File Upload Allowed
issues.description:
It was observed in PwC assessment that files with malicious extensions can be uploaded at various places in the application. 
It was also observed that in a place where the allowed file type was an image, a non-image file could be uploaded and there is no client as well as server-side validation for the same.

https://pmusectest.goodcsr.in/upload/doc/?model=Project&slug=<project-slug>&key=2

Malicious files can be uploaded by an attacker, which can be accessed by other users of the application. Furthermore, the files uploaded on the server are accessible without authentication. An attacker can upload a malicious file, and then share the link with the victim. 

It is recommended to have stringent client as well as server side validation which performs filtering based on:
a) File extensions
b) Content-Types
c) Magic Numbers
d) File Size.

notes.note: @pervin have we implemented file size restriction, if yes what is the limit?

issues.title: Role Based Access not implemented
issues.description:
During the third party security assessment by PwC, it was observed that the application does not implement role-based access properly. The following observations were made in this regard : 

1) A funder, who is not linked to a project, can perform the following tasks, with regards to that project : 
a) Edit project details
b) Add/Edit a tranche
c) Add/Edit values for a parameter
d) Generate a report for any project 
e) Add a note to any project
f) View/Delete user role

2) A file uploaded by a user can be edited by anyone else


Affected URLs
https://pmusectest.goodcsr.in/project/add/?slug=<project-slug>
https://pmusectest.goodcsr.in/project/budget/tranche/?slug=<project-slug>
https://pmusectest.goodcsr.in/project/parameter/values/manage/?id=<id>
https://pmusectest.goodcsr.in/project/budget/tranche/?slug=<project-slug>&tranche_id=<id>
https://pmusectest.goodcsr.in/report/final/design/?slug=<project-slug>&report_id=<id>&div_id=&key=
https://pmusectest.goodcsr.in/dashboard/add/note/?slug=<project-slug>
https://pmusectest.goodcsr.in/upload/edit/?model=<model>&obj_id=<id>&id=<id>


Impact: An existing user of GoodCSR-PMU application can perform actions to which the user should not be able to, as per the user's role. This is against the principle of **least privilege**, which states that a person should be allowed to perform. only those actions to which he/she is authorised. If an attacker is able to register with the application, or somehow obtain the credentials of any existing user, the attacker would be able to exploit this vulnerability to change the data corresponding to various projects.

It is recommended to implement role-based access throughout the application. Users should be allowed to perform only those actions for which they have a documented business purpose.

issues.title: Stored Cross site scripting
issues.description:
In an external security audit done by PwC, it was observed that a funder can enter malicious scripts in summary field while editing/creating any project, even those to which the funder is not linked. 
The scripts would be executed on the browser of the users who visit the project summary page. Through a script, they would also be redirected to another page.

{{"https://pmusectest.goodcsr.in/project/add/?slug=<project-slug> "}}

Impact: If an attacker is able to obtain user credentials of any user, the attacker can create a project and enter malicious scripts in the summary page and add the victims to the project as funder and implementation partner. When the victims open the project from the projects dropdown menu, the project summary page would launch and the script would be executed on their browsers. The attacker can use this vulnerability to steal cookies, take over victim's session, redirect the victim to a malicious site etc.

It is recommended to create a white-list of characters needed by the application and should disallow all requests containing any other character. Furthermore, the application should HTML escape the value of all user controlled parameters before including them in the HTML response.

notes.note: While this is verified to be fixed in sectest env, need to check in live env before marking is as Done and Closed
This is verified by PwC on Oct 4th and repoted as closed in a confirmatory report

Scripts can still be injected. Issue is not fixed. Screens for reference.

![image](/uploads/e6c2b4399a358694ad6c7bcc97333e24/image.png)

issues.title: Pass statement in Except block
issues.description:
During external security assessment by PwC this is reported as Low Risk observation 
* [ ] media/views.py  
* [ ] projectmanagement/manage_roles.py  
* [ ] projectmanagement/templatetags/urs_tags.py  
* [ ] taskmanagement/templatetags/common_tags.py
* [ ] taskmanagement/views.py  
* [ ] thumbs.py  

The use of pass is considered a potential security issue. 

A larger than normal volume of errors from a service can indicate an attempt is being made to disrupt or interfere with it. Thus errors should, at the very least, be logged. 

It is recommended to log the exceptions with timestamp to detect an attempt to disrupt a service

@eswarpriya, @pervin, @malcolm  - for a project is none of the Parameter is identified as Beneficiary indicator, actual beneficiary served will be 0. In this case Project tile will show "0 served", In reality, beneficiaries might be served but it's just that implementation partner hasn't updated the records. For such cases, it is unfair to report as "0 served" instead of how about only reporting planned beneficiary count.

What happens if planned beneficiary is 100 (in project summary). In 1st month (say apr) itself, 70 are enrolled and served hence parameter is added with the value of 70. issues.title: Mobile Friendly Responsive Pages
issues.description:
Pages that are likely to be used frequently by the implementation partners need to be mobile friendly and hence responsive. Out of these, those are likely to be accessed during field visit need to be on priority. It must be noted that this functionality will still require internet access and hence can't work in offline mode as required by PI foundation. 
* [ ] Upload Images/Timeline - during field visit if there is any important picture which connveys the progress/impact or helps in narrating program story. In case internet connection is not available as workaround photos can be tagged/placed in an album which can then be uploaded when connectivity is achieved.  Else we can think of providing connector to pull the photos from google photos or icloud which typically get synched automatically when user gets internet connectivity.  
* [ ] My Task - for updating the status while traveling 
* [ ] Updates - to browse through the past happenings for reference. 
* [ ] Update Parameters - apart for entering values image attachments if any may need to be updated from mobile

issues.title: Gantt Chart | Option to have period starting from 1st planned start date
issues.description:
There are some projects for which there is a considerable gap between start date entered on project summary page (which is same as MoU date with implementation partner) and date from which actual activities are planned and executed. 

Currently, the gantt chart uses project start date as the initial date for rendering activities and tasks, this leaves some blank area in the initial part of the gantt chart. Instead, if we use the earliest planned start date of all the activities then it will have a better visual experience.

notes.note: There are projects in Altico which will be benefited by this enhancement and hence urgency is set to very high.

issues.title: SuperCategory: Ability to have distinct super category for Budget and Activities
issues.description:
Currently, Supercatogries are shared across budget as well as for activity grouping.

But there are situations where Budget grouping and activity grouping need to be done differently. E.g. one of the NGO covers Primary Schools and Higher Secondary Schools at different locations. For budget expected to be tracked at the Primary/Secondary school level and not at locations level. But from work progress tracking activities need to be tracked at each location and not at the primary/secondary school level. To model this requirement we need to have a flag for supercategories which indicates if it is applicable for Budget as well as Activities i.e. Both (this will be the default) or Budget only or Activity only.

This will impact the following functionalities 
* [ ] Project Dashboard - Budget Pie Chart
* [ ] Project Dashboard - Gantt Chart
* [ ] Budget - Add Super Catagory
* [ ] Budget - Add/Edit Budget Details 
* [ ] Activities & Tasks - Supercategory wise progress
* [ ] Activities & Tasks - Add/Edit Activity
